scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes RegOrg in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
Core Vocabularies can be used as the foundation of common export formats for data in base registries like cadastral, business registers or public service portals. The Registered Organisation Vocabulary as well as the Core Business Vocabulary (it is the same vocabulary but it was renamed) can be used to describe and ease the publication of information as open data. There is an example of the publication of data as Linked Open Data: "Greek Tax Authorities business registry published as linked open data using core business and core location".

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

RegOrg Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/registered-organization-vocabulary/about

Core Business Vocabulary reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-business-vocabulary

Greek Tax Authorities business registry published as linked open data using core business and core location:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/registered-organization-vocabulary/news/core-business-and-core-locati

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
The Registered Organisation Vocabulary was first developed and published by the European Commission ISA Programme with support from the Directorate General Internal Market and Services. The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) as an action of ISA², has established Working Groups. These Working Groups are open to the participation of everyone interested in semantic solutions working for public administrations in the Member States or in EU institutions.

SEMIC working groups:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/about

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
The Semantic Interoperability Community (SEMIC) develops solutions to help European public administrations perform seamless and meaningful cross-border and cross-domain data exchanges. They develop semantic specifications and interoperability solutions under the ISA² Programme. When a new solution release is finished, it is submitted for a public review with a minimum period of four weeks.

Specification development process by the ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/semantic-interoperability-community-semic/document/description-change-management-release-and-publication-process-structural-metadata-specifications

Detailed document ISA Programme:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/document/2016-10/description_of_a_change_management_release_and_publication_process_for_structural_metadata_specifications_developed_by_the_isa_progr.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was developed in 2012 by an Action of ISA2. In 2013, it was standardised by W3C. This fact demonstrates that the specification has overcome the initial problems. On 23 May 2012, the Coordination Group of the Interoperability Solutions for European Public Administrations (ISA) Programme renamed the specification to Core Business Vocabulary and it has been added to e-Government Core Vocabularies. So the specifications can be considered mature for its use in the development of products and services.

RegOrg W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-regorg/

RegOrg Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/registered-organization-vocabulary/about

Core Business Vocabulary reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-business-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Although the usage of Registered Organisation Vocabulary has been replaced by the Core Business Vocacabulary in the e-Government Core Vocabularies solution, it has the same content and it is sufficiently mature for the development of products and services. Specifically, there are implementations at European Level combining the Core Business Vocabulary and the Organisation Ontology as it can be seen in the following links.

RegOrg Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/registered-organization-vocabulary

Core Business Vocabulary reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-business-vocabulary

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/registered-organization-vocabulary/document/describe-organizations-rdf-core-business-vocabulary-and-org-ontology

criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The main purpose of RegOrg is to capture the typical details recorded by business registers and thereby facilitate information exchange between them. So it facilitates the visibility of the different legal entities' data, including public administrations.

RegOrg about Joinup reference:

criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The adoption of RegOrg as a data model does not hamper the scalability of systems. The use of existing data models for the development of common information systems facilitates the development of those systems and improves their interoperability. Moreover, RegOrg facilitates information exchange between business registers.

RegOrg Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/registered-organization-vocabulary

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The Registered Organization Vocabulary is a simplified, reusable and extensible data model that captures the fundamental characteristics of a legal entity. It facilitates the information exchange between business sectors. So, it fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services.

RegOrg Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/registered-organization-vocabulary

RegOrg W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-regorg/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The application of the once-only principle in all EU Member States public administrations aims at reducing the administrative burden. This Core Vocabulary fosters interoperability between public administrations, easing the exchange of business information. An example of this is business registers, which describing legal entities eases its reuse and exchange helping to implement the Once-Only Principle. 

RegOrg Joinup reference:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/registered-organization-vocabulary

statement:

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/registered-organization-vocabulary

criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The Registered Organization Vocabulary is a simplified, reusable and extensible data model that captures the fundamental characteristics of a legal entity. It facilitates the information exchange between business sectors and organisations, fostering the digitization of the administrations' transaction. Therefore, it reduces the administrative burden by avoiding the exchange of non-digital documents.

statement: After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the RegOrg in terms of efficiency or effectiveness.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
RegOrg is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, RegOrg can define the interoperability aspects of the "Core Data Model" and "Data" ABBs of the EIRA Semantic View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
As a vocabulary, the implementation of RegOrg can be tested using methods like SHACL shapes and using semantic reasoners to ensure that the implementation is well-formed. These validation mechanisms can be used with open source tools or lite versions of tools like GrapghDB or Protégé.

SHACL validation: 
https://graphdb.ontotext.com/documentation/free/shacl-validation.html#what-is-shacl-validation

Semantic Reasoners List: 
http://owl.cs.manchester.ac.uk/tools/list-of-reasoners/

statement:
There are no Member States recommending RegOrg in their ICT National Catalogues.
 
CAMSS List of Standards:

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
This Core Vocabulary offers several services that aim to help e-Government professionals share their experience, and reuse data and services across borders. Specifically, the RegOrg vocabulary was used in the Business Registries Interconnection System (BRIS), which is aimed to facilitate the distribution of information from each of the Member States’ business registers to the registers of other Member States in a standard message format and in the relevant language version. 

JoinUp Webpage:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/

Core Vocabularies in action:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/sites/default/files/news/attachment/eu_core_vocabularies_in_action_using_core_business_vocabulary_in_the_eu_.pdf

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
RegOrg is not included in any Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. statement:

criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
Since the RegOrg is involved in cross-border projects like BRIS, it can be considered that exists an interoperability agreement for the inclusion of the specification as part of interoperable solutions.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Core Vocabularies can be used as the foundation of common export formats for data in base registries like cadastral, business registers or public service portals. The Registered Organisation Vocabulary as well as the Core Business Vocabulary can be used to describe and ease the publication of information as open data. There is an example of the publication of data as Linked Open Data: "Greek Tax Authorities business registry published as linked open data using core business and core location".

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/
